TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Properties extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A Properties object is a Hashtable where the keys and values must be Strings.

remarks.para: A Properties object is a Hashtable where the keys and values must be Strings. Each property can have a default Properties list which specifies the default values to be used when a given key is not found in this Properties instance.

Note that in some cases Properties uses ISO-8859-1 instead of UTF-8. ISO-8859-1 is only capable of representing a tiny subset of Unicode. Use either the loadFromXML/storeToXML methods (which use UTF-8 by default) or the load/store overloads that take an OutputStreamWriter (so you can supply a UTF-8 instance) instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Load (Java.IO.Reader in);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Load(class Java.IO.Reader in) cil managed

Docs.summary: Loads properties from the specified Reader.

remarks.para:
Loads properties from the specified Reader. The properties file is interpreted according to the following rules:
Empty lines are ignored.
Lines starting with either a "#" or a "!" are comment lines and are ignored.
A backslash at the end of the line escapes the following newline character ("\r", "\n", "\r\n"). If there's whitespace after the backslash it will just escape that whitespace instead of concatenating the lines. This does not apply to comment lines.
A property line consists of the key, the space between the key and the value, and the value. The key goes up to the first whitespace, "=" or ":" that is not escaped. The space between the key and the value contains either one whitespace, one "=" or one ":" and any amount of additional whitespace before and after that character. The value starts with the first character after the space between the key and the value.
Following escape sequences are recognized: "\ ", "\\", "\r", "\n", "\!", "\#", "\t", "\b", "\f", and "\uXXXX" (unicode character).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Load (System.IO.Stream in);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Load(class System.IO.Stream in) cil managed

Docs.summary: Loads properties from the specified InputStream, assumed to be ISO-8859-1.

remarks.para: Loads properties from the specified InputStream, assumed to be ISO-8859-1. See "".

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void LoadFromXML (System.IO.Stream in);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadFromXML(class System.IO.Stream in) cil managed

Docs.param: the InputStream containing the XML document.
Docs.summary: Loads the properties from an InputStream containing the properties in XML form.

remarks.para:
Loads the properties from an InputStream containing the properties in XML form. The XML document must begin with (and conform to) following DOCTYPE:
<!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd">
Also the content of the XML data must satisfy the DTD but the xml is not validated against it. The DTD is not loaded from the SYSTEM ID. After this method returns the InputStream is not closed.

Docs.exception: in case an error occurs during a read operation.
if the XML data is not a valid properties file.

Docs.exception: if the key or value of a mapping is not a String.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void StoreToXML (System.IO.Stream os, string comment);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void StoreToXML(class System.IO.Stream os, string comment) cil managed

Docs.param: the comment to add. If null, no comment is added.
Docs.summary: Writes all properties stored in this instance into the OutputStream in XML representation.

remarks.para:
Writes all properties stored in this instance into the OutputStream in XML representation. The DOCTYPE is
<!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd">
If the comment is null, no comment is added to the output. UTF-8 is used as the encoding. The OutputStream is not closed at the end. A call to this method is the same as a call to storeToXML(os, comment, "UTF-8").

Docs.exception: if an error occurs during writing to the output.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void StoreToXML (System.IO.Stream os, string comment, string encoding);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void StoreToXML(class System.IO.Stream os, string comment, string encoding) cil managed

Docs.param: the comment to add. If null, no comment is added.
the code identifying the encoding that should be used to write into the OutputStream.
Docs.summary: Writes all properties stored in this instance into the OutputStream in XML representation.

remarks.para:
Writes all properties stored in this instance into the OutputStream in XML representation. The DOCTYPE is
<!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd">
If the comment is null, no comment is added to the output. The parameter encoding defines which encoding should be used. The OutputStream is not closed at the end.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs during writing to the output.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
